Discussions included S-400 systems, Sukhoi upgrades, and BrahMos missile advancements, underscoring a commitment to bolstering India's indigenous defense capabilities and maintaining a strong partnership with Moscow.

description: President Putin's visit to New Delhi has transformed key areas into a heavily fortified zone, mirroring G20 security measures. His custom-built Aurus Senat limousine, a "rolling bunker," was flown in for his protection. A five-layer security grid, combining Russian and Indian elite forces, ensures his safety, with snipers and anti-drone systems deployed.

description: Rajasthan high court affirmed that two consenting adults, even below marriageable age, have the right to a live-in relationship. Rejecting the argument that the male's age prevented cohabitation, the court cited Article 21, stating fundamental rights cannot be denied. Live-in relationships are not illegal, and the state must ensure protection.

author: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY
description: The Supreme Court has cautioned police and trial courts against filing chargesheets and framing charges without a strong prima facie case, citing judicial system congestion. Justices emphasized that prosecution should only proceed with a reasonable prospect of conviction, especially in civil disputes, acting as crucial filters to maintain judicial efficiency and integrity.
title: File charges only if there’s reasonable conviction chance: Supreme Court

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: A TADA court quashed a warrant against Shafat Ahmed Shangloo, arrested as an accomplice in the 1989 Rubaiya Sayeed abduction. The court found Shangloo was "inadvertently" named, as he was listed in the 1991 chargesheet as "released for want of evidence," not an "absconding accused." Warrants against seven others were also cancelled.
title: Arrested suspect in Rubaiya abduction was 'inadvertently' named in CBI warrant: Court

author: etimes.in
description: Bigg Boss 19's grand finale is set for December 7, with the Top 5 finalists now revealed. Malti Chahar was the latest contestant eliminated after a 'Magical Kadhai' challenge, leaving Farrhana Bhatt as the fifth finalist. Malti departed without forgiving Pranit More, citing his behavior throughout the season.
title: Bigg Boss 19: Malti Chahar gets eliminated; refuses to forgive Amaal Mallik

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Sheikh Abdullah's legacy lives on in people's hearts, regardless of his birth anniversary holiday status, stated J&K CM Omar Abdullah. He emphasized that holiday decisions rest with the Centre, not the elected government, and that such observances don't measure his contributions. The National Conference plans a grand event for the anniversary.
title: Holiday or not, Sheikh Abdullah resides in hearts: Omar

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Jammu Police have dismantled a cross-border narco-terror network, arresting six individuals and seizing 5kg of heroin worth over Rs 30 crore, along with arms. Investigations revealed connections to Pakistani handlers fueling anti-India activities. The operation, initiated by suspicious pedestrians, led to the unravelling of a sophisticated drug and arms supply chain.
title: J&K Police bust Pak-linked narco-terror syndicate; 6 held with 5kg heroin, 3 pistols

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Virginia football coach Travis L. Turner vanished amid grave child abuse allegations, just as police sought to question him. Charged with child sexual abuse material possession and soliciting a minor, Turner, armed, reportedly entered a nearby forest. The U.S. Marshals are offering a $5,000 reward for information on the missing coach, as search efforts continue.
title: Travis Turner case: Virginia coach’s family in focus amid child abuse charges

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Lakers' star Luka Doncic is unexpectedly absent from tonight's game against the Toronto Raptors due to personal reasons. He is currently in Slovenia, preparing to welcome his second child. This absence poses a significant challenge for the Lakers, who will need to adapt their strategy to secure a win without their leading scorer. Fans eagerly await his return.
title: Why isn’t Luka Doncic playing tonight vs Raptors despite being healthy?

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is reportedly planning significant resource cuts, potentially as high as 30%, for its metaverse division, including virtual worlds and VR units. This comes as the company shifts its focus towards artificial intelligence development, with budget reductions expected to impact the VR group and potentially lead to layoffs early next year.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Zardari appointed Army Chief Asim Munir as Pakistan's first Chief of Defence Forces for five years, following the 27th Constitutional Amendment. This new role unifies command across the armed forces, replacing the abolished CJCSC. Munir now holds a dual position as COAS and CDF, a significant shift in military hierarchy.
title: Asim Munir gets total power: Pak prez approves appointment as CDF - what it means

author: CHIDANAND RAJGHATTA
description: US President Donald Trump announced a significant rollback of fuel-economy standards, lowering targets from 50.4 mpg to 34.5 mpg. This decision effectively shifts the global decarbonization burden to nations like China and India, which are rapidly advancing in electric mobility and renewable energy.
title: Kill Baby Kill: Trump rolls back US fuel economy standards calling it 'green new scam'

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Blue Origin is developing an AI-powered device to convert moon dust into a power source, tackling the challenge of the two-week lunar night. This lunar vacuum, created with Istari Digital's technology, extracts heat from dust, acting like a battery.  AI was crucial in designing the device, ensuring all requirements and standards were met for operational use.
title: Moon dust battery: Blue Origin's AI-vacuum cleaner for space; How it works

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's central bank is allowing the rupee to weaken due to slowing dollar inflows, widening trade pressures, and heavy foreign selling. The Reserve Bank of India is shifting focus from defending specific exchange rates to preventing disorderly movements, as the rupee becomes Asia's worst-performing currency this year.
title: Rupee slide: RBI lets currency weaken amid outflows; focus shifts to curbing speculation

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The Indian rupee has breached Rs 90 against the US dollar for the first time, driven by weak capital flows, importer demand, and trade deal uncertainty. This decline has impacted equity markets, prompting foreign investor selling despite strong domestic fundamentals. Analysts warn of further depreciation if the rupee sustains above this psychological barrier.
title: Rupee slumps: What the currency’s fall beyond 90 per dollar means for investors

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: US authorities have temporarily eased sanctions on Lukoil-branded fuel stations outside Russia, allowing them to operate until April 2026. This move impacts stations in the US and elsewhere, while India faces a significant drop in Russian crude imports due to sanctions on Lukoil and Rosneft, impacting major refiners.
title: US eases curbs on Lukoil outlets outside Russia; exemption valid till April 2026

author: NIKITA PATNAIK
description: Connor McDavid’s status is in focus as the Edmonton Oilers get set for a key home matchup against the Seattle Kraken. With Edmonton looking to build consistency, McDavid’s availability tonight stands out as a major storyline heading into the December 4 meeting.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Intel has reversed its plan to sell or spin off its Networking and Edge Group (NEX) division, stating that the unit is now best positioned to succeed internally. The company had initially sought to sell non-core assets like NEX to boost its finances amid struggles with rivals like TSMC and Samsung Electronics.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: General Motors CEO Mary Barra revealed she privately corrected President Biden after a 2021 White House event that excluded Tesla. Barra told Biden that Tesla deserved recognition for its EV advancements, a sentiment echoed by Kamala Harris who later acknowledged the snub. This exclusion fueled a rift between Biden and Elon Musk, impacting political alliances and EV policy debates.

description: Despite Nifty 50 and Sensex reaching record highs, broad market optimism is limited as nearly half of NSE's top 500 stocks lag key technical benchmarks. description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to India aims to significantly boost economic cooperation, with New Delhi seeking to reduce its trade deficit and expand market access for Indian goods like pharmaceuticals and agricultural products. description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei dismissed rivals' 'code red' emergencies, stating his company's focus on enterprise clients allows for steady development. This approach, coupled with responsible growth management, positions Anthropic to navigate the competitive AI landscape.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Security agencies launched an extensive search operation in Ajmer, Rajasthan, following a bomb threat email claiming RDX-based explosives were planted at the Ajmer Sharif dargah, district collectorate, and Kudankulam Nuclear Power Plant. The email warned of detonation coinciding with Russian President Vladimir Putin's arrival. Premises were evacuated and thoroughly checked, with no suspicious objects found so far.
title: Bomb threat to nuclear plant: Search ops launched; email mentions Putin visit

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Joe Root finally ended his long wait for a Test century in Australia, reaching the milestone at the Gabba. This achievement brought relief to former Australian opener Matthew Hayden, who had publicly vowed to "walk nude around the MCG" if Root failed to score a hundred on the tour. Root reached the milestone in 181 balls.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Nvidia's co-founder and CEO, Jensen Huang, became a billionaire after a childhood detour to a Kentucky reform school. This experience instilled a strong work ethic, shaping his leadership style as a demanding perfectionist. Huang's relentless pursuit of "extraordinary things" has propelled Nvidia to become a global AI powerhouse.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Salesforce reported strong quarterly earnings, exceeding analyst expectations and offering a boost to CEO Marc Benioff amidst investor concerns about AI profitability. Despite a recent market value drop, the company's AI agent strategy, including layoffs, aims for significant future revenue. Benioff remains optimistic about customer adoption and long-term growth targets.

description: IndiGo faces a nationwide operational crisis with widespread flight cancellations and delays, leaving lakhs of passengers stranded and sparking anger. description: Gold prices dipped on Thursday amid mixed global trends and weak US economic data, while silver futures saw gains. Investors are cautiously awaiting key US inflation data for clarity on the Federal Reserve's monetary policy. Geopolitical tensions also contributed to a risk premium for precious metals.

description: Hardik Pandya has completed his domestic warm-up and will join the Indian squad in Cuttack on December 6 for the T20I series against South Africa. After recovering from injury, Pandya showed promising form with both bat and ball in two Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy matches.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: As President Putin prepares for a visit to India, old images of him with Prime Minister Modi from 2001 have resurfaced. Then Gujarat Chief Minister Modi accompanied PM Vajpayee to Moscow, marking his first international engagement and early diplomatic interaction with Putin. The visit fostered cooperation between Gujarat and Russia's Astrakhan region.
title: Moscow callback: When Modi first met Putin; photos from 2001 go viral

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: In a remarkable turn of events, Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang managed to persuade lawmakers to dismiss the GAIN AI Act, designed to favor American chip buyers over their Chinese counterparts. Huang described the decision to exclude this bill from the defense package as 'shrewd,' acknowledging the potential risks it posed to the US chip industry's global standing.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrives in New Delhi for a crucial summit with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking to bolster energy and arms ties amidst Western sanctions. India navigates a diplomatic tightrope, balancing its historical partnership with Moscow against growing ties with Washington, aiming for strategic autonomy.

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The rupee recovered from its record low, closing at 89.96 against the US dollar after a softer dollar index and reported RBI intervention. Despite initial weakness due to foreign selling and trade deal delays, the currency found support. Analysts anticipate continued pressure from outflows but potential cushioning from a subdued dollar and possible RBI actions.
title: Rupee rebounds as RBI support, softer dollar offer relief; ends day at 89.96 per USD

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Swaraj Kaushal, former Mizoram Governor and husband of the late Sushma Swaraj, passed away at 73 after a brief illness. He was a senior advocate with a distinguished public and legal career. His daughter, MP Bansuri Swaraj, expressed profound grief, finding solace in his reunion with her mother. Leaders mourned his contributions.
title: Sushma Swaraj's husband Swaraj Kaushal passes away; PM condoles death

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Government sources have refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims that opposition leaders are barred from meeting foreign dignitaries. They stated that the Ministry of External Affairs facilitates official meetings, while engagements outside this framework are at the visitor's discretion. Several foreign leaders have met Gandhi since he became Leader of the Opposition, including Prime Ministers from Bangladesh, Malaysia, Mauritius, and New Zealand.
title: 'Up to delegation': Govt counters Rahul's Putin meet claim; BJP piles on

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former India coach Ravi Shastri has strongly defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma against doubts about their ODI future. He emphasised that players of their stature should not be questioned, stating that if they perform, their critics will quickly fade away. Shastri's remarks come amid discussions about India's long-term team planning for the 2027 World Cup.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: OpenAI is reportedly in advanced talks with Tata Group, specifically TCS, to establish AI compute infrastructure in India. This collaboration aims to build agentic AI solutions for enterprises, marking a significant step for both companies. The partnership follows OpenAI's earlier discussions with Reliance Industries, which did not materialize.

author: TNN
description: A local election in Munnar has taken an ironic turn as the BJP fields Sonia Gandhi, named after the Congress stalwart, against the official Congress candidate. This unusual situation is sparking debate, potentially swaying voters and reshaping the local political landscape.

description: Harbhajan Singh urges India to win without Jasprit Bumrah after South Africa's historic 359 chase. He suggests recalling Varun Chakaravarthy to the ODI squad, emphasizing the need for match-winners in shorter formats. The series is now tied 1-1 heading into the decider.

description: Indian pilots' body accuses IndiGo of a hiring freeze and poor planning, leading to flight cancellations and delays. The Federation of Indian Pilots urges the DGCA to reallocate IndiGo's slots if commitments to passengers remain unmet due to avoidable shortages.

description: Microsoft AI's design chief aims for her 200-person team to be fully AI-fluent by year-end, a significant step as AI now powers 20-30% of the company's code. The move aligns with CEO Nadella's vision of integrating emotional intelligence with technical prowess in the AI era.

description: Former India opener Aakash Chopra has expressed bewilderment over Mohammed Siraj's exclusion from the ODI setup. He questioned the decision, highlighting Siraj's strong ODI record and contrasting it with the struggles of other young pacers who were preferred. Chopra finds it inexplicable that Siraj has seemingly become a red-ball specialist.

description: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, broaden the definition of 'wages,' potentially increasing gratuity payouts for employees. author: TOI Education
description: The Tamil Nadu Uniformed Services Recruitment Board has released the hall tickets for the 2025 Sub-Inspector recruitment, with candidates required to download them from tnusrb.tn.gov.in. The Main Written Exam and Tamil Language Eligibility Test will be held on December 21 across 46 centres. TNUSRB has activated multiple helplines for support and issued strict exam-day guidelines, including a complete ban on electronic devices.

description: An Indigo flight from Madina to Hyderabad made an emergency landing in Ahmedabad due to a suspected bomb threat. title: 180 aboard: Amid nationwide disruptions, IndiGo flight gets bomb threat

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mitchell Starc has become the most successful left-arm fast bowler in Test cricket, surpassing Wasim Akram's record of 414 wickets. The Australian achieved this milestone at the Gabba, his debut venue, in his 102nd Test. Starc's early wickets provided Australia with a strong start in the Ashes Test, despite England's recovery.
title: Ashes: Starc rewrites history! Surpasses Akram as most successful left-arm Test pacer

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: A rare defeat for India saw Virat Kohli's brilliant century go in vain as South Africa chased down 358 to level the ODI series. This marked the first loss in nearly seven years despite a Kohli ton, highlighting an unusual outcome.  Aiden Markram's century also played a crucial role in the visitors' successful chase.
title: IND vs SA: Heartbreak! When was the last time India lost an ODI despite a Kohli century?

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Drug licensing authorities nationwide are now mandated to display a Quick Response (QR) code and toll-free number at all pharmacies. This initiative, driven by the CDSCO, aims to simplify the reporting of adverse drug reactions by the public and healthcare professionals directly into the PvPI Adverse Drug Reaction Monitoring System, enhancing drug safety across India.
title: New mandate for Chemists: New QR Code and toll-free number; what it means for buyers

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed state governments to provide additional staff to reduce the workload of Booth Level Officers (BLOs) involved in EC's SIR exercise. This comes amid reports of excessive pressure and alleged suicides, with the court emphasising case-by-case consideration for exemption requests and ensuring adequate workforce. The direction was issued after TVK's plea flagging BLO plight.
title: 'Obligated to provide': SC tells states to deploy more staff for SIR; TVK plea flags BLO plight

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'Visible from space': Astronaut shares orbital view of Mecca 400kms above the earth

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: IndiGo flights faced massive disruptions, with only 19.7% operating on time Wednesday, leading to hundreds of cancellations. This crisis is linked to new pilot duty norms and questions are raised about the airline's preparedness and regulatory oversight. IndiGo has cut flights for 48 hours to stabilize operations, offering passengers refunds or alternatives.
title: At 19.7%, IndiGo on time performance rock-bottomed on Wednesday

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: Jio users on Indian highways will soon receive real-time safety alerts on their phones, a result of a new partnership with NHAI. This telecom-based warning system will notify travellers of hazards like accident-prone zones and diversions via SMS, WhatsApp, and voice calls.
title: Driving on highways? Jio will now send safety warnings to your phone: Details

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Hours before Russia President Putin's arrival, Rahul Gandhi criticized the Modi government for breaking the tradition of allowing the Leader of Opposition to meet foreign dignitaries. He stated this practice, observed under Vajpayee and Manmohan Singh, is now ignored due to government insecurity. Putin's visit will focus on trade, technology, and regional issues, with several agreements expected.
title: 'Govt doesn't want us to meet': Rahul's big charge amid Putin's India visit; Tharoor agrees

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Run-machine Virat Kohli's brilliant 102 wasn't enough as South Africa chased down 359 in Raipur, levelling the three-match series 1-1.  Kohli's century, his 53rd ODI ton, saw him equal Sachin Tendulkar's record for hundreds at 34 venues.  Ruturaj Gaikwad also scored a century in their record partnership against the Proteas.
title: IND vs SA: Kohli equals Tendulkar’s world record - full list of milestones set in Raipur

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former spinner Harbhajan Singh passionately defended Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, questioning the authority of less accomplished individuals to dictate their future. He highlighted their current strong performances, emphasising they are setting benchmarks for younger players and deserve to be considered for the 2027 ODI World Cup. Harbhajan also advocated for better Test pitches in India.
title: IND vs SA: ‘People who haven't achieved much are deciding Ro-Ko's future': Harbhajan slams critics

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Micron is discontinuing its Crucial consumer memory brand by February 2026, shifting all chip production to lucrative AI data centers. This move, driven by soaring demand and premium pricing for AI hardware, leaves PC enthusiasts facing significantly higher memory costs and limited options.
title: Micron kills 29-year-old Crucial brand because AI needs all the memory

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: NASA's Perseverance rover has unveiled a captivating phenomenon: tiny electrical sparks, likened to 'mini-lightning', occurring within the Martian dust devils and storms. This crucial discovery not only validates a longstanding scientific hypothesis but also has the potential to revolutionize our comprehension of the Red Planet's atmospheric features and habitability.
title: ‘Mini-sonic booms’ on Mars: Nasa rover records electric sparks in dust devils — watch

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: President Vladimir Putin arrives in India for a significant visit. He will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi for private dinner diplomacy. Day two includes a Rajghat tribute and summit talks. Discussions will focus on strengthening economic ties, trade, and cooperation in technology and energy. Several bilateral agreements are expected to be signed, charting a roadmap for future collaboration until 2030.
title: Putin’s India visit: Private dinner with PM Modi, Rajghat visit — what’s on itinerary

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Raj Nidimoru and Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently married at Isha Yoga Centre. Amidst congratulatory messages, attention turned to Raj's ex-wife, Shhyamali De. She shared a lengthy social media note expressing gratitude for well wishes while dealing with her Jyotish guru's Stage 4 cancer diagnosis.
title: Raj Nidimoru’s ex-wife pens a lengthy note after his and Samantha Ruth Prabhu’s wedding

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: A depreciating rupee beyond Rs 90 against the US dollar is poised to trigger price hikes across consumer electronics, beauty products, and automobiles. This could negate recent GST rate cut benefits, impacting sales momentum. Manufacturers are planning 3-10% increases from December-January to offset rising import costs.
title: Rupee touches 90! Get ready to pay higher for consumer goods; what may become costlier

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is facing significant flight disruptions, with hundreds of cancellations and delays due to new pilot rest and duty-hour regulations. Despite a month since implementation, the airline struggles to adapt, leading to a sharp drop in on-time performance. IndiGo cites operational challenges and expects disruptions to continue.
title: 'Strategic mistake': IndiGo flight disruptions due to new roster rules? What DGCA norms say

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: The Geminids meteor shower, a consistent and bright celestial event, is set for a spectacular display in 2025. With minimal moonlight during its peak on December 13-14, stargazers can anticipate 60-120 meteors per hour. This unique shower, originating from asteroid 3200 Phaethon, offers a prime opportunity for unforgettable cosmic viewing.
title: When and where to watch the Geminids meteor shower 2025 peak nights

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Trinamool Congress suspended MLA Humayun Kabir for planning a mosque foundation ceremony modelled on the Babri Masjid on December 6, despite party warnings and Raj Bhawan's concerns. Kabir defied the party and Governor, vowing to proceed and warning of highway blockades if stopped, escalating tensions in Murshidabad.
title: 'Will build Babri' remark: TMC suspends Humayun Kabir; MLA had warned to block highway

author: PRANTIK PRABAL ROY
description: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.
title: Travis Kelce’s bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu champions American tech's trend of high schoolers skipping college for work, urging Indian parents to recognize this "profound cultural shift." He highlights Palantir's experiment hiring graduates directly, emphasizing empowerment and avoiding student debt. Vembu advocates for companies to remove degree requirements, citing Zoho's success with young, degreeless talent.
title: 'Cultural shift': Zoho's Vembu on US 'skip college' trend; why Indian parents should worry

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: On International Cheetah Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to social media, showcasing heartwarming images and celebrating the remarkable achievements of Project Cheetah. This visionary initiative, active for three years now, is dedicated to revitalizing India's ecological landscape by reintroducing cheetahs to Kuno National Park.
title: International Cheetah Day: PM Modi celebrates 'one of the planet's most remarkable creatures' — see pics

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Grapes, a globally cherished fruit, offer a wealth of nutrients including vitamins, minerals, fibre, and antioxidants. While all varieties are beneficial, black and red grapes boast higher antioxidant levels like resveratrol, supporting heart health and reducing inflammation. Green grapes excel in hydration and vitamin content, making a varied intake ideal for overall well-being.
title: Which grapes are healthiest green black or red and why

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra deflected questions on the rupee breaching the 90 mark against the US dollar, urging reporters to ask Prime Minister Narendra Modi about his 2013 remarks on the falling rupee. Meanwhile, Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran stated the government is not concerned about the currency's decline, as it is not impacting inflation or exports.
title: 'Why ask me?': Priyanka Vadra on rupee; brings up PM Modi's past remark on Manmohan Singh

author: MANTHAN K MEHTA, CHAITANYA MARPAKWAR, PRADEEP GUPTA
description: A 19-year-old student's alleged suicide after being assaulted on a Mumbai local train for speaking Hindi has ignited a political firestorm. Tensions over language, exacerbated by crowded commutes and nativist politics, have boiled over on the city's suburban railway network, leading to a heated debate and protests.
title: Why Hindi becomes a flashpoint on Mumbai locals? Teen's death sparks big political storm

author: VIBHA SHARMA
description: MCD bypolls delivered mixed results for BJP and AAP, with both parties losing key strongholds. Several contests were decided by narrow margins, highlighting a shifting political landscape. The elections served as a crucial test for the BJP government, with public sentiment influencing outcomes in several wards.
title: Razor-thin victories, key losses: Mixed signals for BJP & AAP in Delhi MCD bypoll results

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: A Bengaluru techie tragically ended his life, citing relentless harassment from neighbours and civic officials over a Rs 20 lakh demand. Murali Govindaraju was found dead in his under-construction home, leaving a note detailing his torment. His neighbours have been arrested, accused of extorting money under the guise of activism, leading to this devastating outcome.
title: Bengaluru techie's death note: How 'dream house' became trap for software professional

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The Trump administration has intensified H-1B visa vetting, scrutinizing applicants and their families for involvement in 'censorship' of free speech. This includes reviewing social media for content moderation or misinformation roles.  The move aims to prevent individuals deemed complicit in suppressing expression from entering the U.S., particularly those in tech.
title: H-1B visa row: US orders enhanced vetting for applicants — what are the new requirements?

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: IndiGo continues to face nationwide delays, cancellations; flight fares soar — 10 things to know

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Imran Khan, from jail, launched a scathing attack on Pakistan's army chief, Asim Munir, calling him "mentally unstable" and accusing him of disastrous policies that fuel terrorism and ignite tensions with Afghanistan. Khan alleged Munir prioritizes pleasing Western powers over national interests, leading to constitutional collapse and fabricated cases against him and his wife.
title: 'Mentally unstable man': Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan fires sharp salvo at Asim Munir

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The Indian rupee hit a record low of 90.43 against the US dollar, marking its fastest decline in under a year. This depreciation is driven by foreign portfolio investment withdrawals, trade deficits, and a strong dollar, despite RBI interventions. However, the government remains optimistic about currency improvement and foreign direct investment inflows next year.
title: Rupee hits another low! Currency slumps to 90.43 against US dollar; what it means

author: GAURAV GUPTA
description: Rohit Sharma, despite retiring from T20 Internationals, has expressed his keenness to represent Mumbai in the upcoming Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy knockouts.  The star batter, currently engaged in the ODI series against South Africa, could feature for Mumbai in the tournament's final stages. This move aligns with BCCI's mandate for Indian players to participate in domestic cricket when available.
title: SMAT: Rohit Sharma ready to play for Mumbai; knockouts from Dec 12-18

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Thursday. While Nifty50 was below 26,000, BSE Sensex was down nearly 100 points.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 26,000; BSE Sensex down around 100 points

author: SAMAD HOQUE
description: A 58-year-old cyclist was fatally struck by a car in Gurgaon's DLF 2. The hit-and-run incident occurred during his routine morning ride, with CCTV footage identifying the vehicle. Police are actively tracing the owner for arrest, while the community raises concerns about road safety within residential areas.
title: Gurgaon hit-&-run: Bizman mowed down by speeding car while cycling; CCTV footage emerges

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India captain KL Rahul attributed their four-wicket ODI loss to South Africa to the toss and heavy dew, despite a massive 358/5 powered by centuries from Kohli and Gaikwad. South Africa's record chase of 362/6 was lauded by skipper Temba Bavuma, who highlighted tactical decisions and internal competition as key factors in their victory.
title: IND vs SA: 'I'm kicking myself' - Rahul reveals 'real' reasons behind India's shock defeat

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A University of Delaware student, Luqmaan Khan, was arrested with a cache of weapons, body armor, and a manifesto detailing plans for a mass shooting and seeking "martyrdom." Police found the arsenal in his truck and later at his home, including an illegal automatic weapon. Khan allegedly expressed a desire to become a martyr.
title: 'Kill all' manifesto: How Pak immigrant planned a University of Delaware attack — details

author: LACHIT ROY
description: Siena University mourns the loss of men's lacrosse coach Liam Gleason, 41, who passed away Wednesday following a severe head injury from a home accident. Gleason, who led the Saints to a MAAC title, was a beloved figure in the lacrosse community. His legacy includes building a strong program and deep connections on and off the field.
title: Liam Gleason’s cause of death: Siena men’s lacrosse coach dies at 41

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Pakistan is set to auction its state-owned airline, PIA, on December 23rd as part of a crucial IMF program. This privatization aims to revive the struggling carrier, restore its global flight operations, and meet modern aviation standards. Prime Minister Sharif emphasized transparency in the bidding process, which, if successful, will be Pakistan's first major privatization in two decades.
title: Loss-making PIA on block: Pak moves to sell national carrier; previous bid failed

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to Delhi has significantly boosted occupancy and tariffs for the city's five-star hotels. Alongside major international events, the presidential suite at ITC Maurya is booked, with other top hotels also sold out. This surge in demand, driven by both official delegations and upcoming weddings, highlights the impact of large-scale events on the hospitality sector.
title: Putin in Delhi today: How Russian president's visit sent five-star rates to dizzying heights

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: BofA Securities maintains a neutral stance on PB Fintech, while Jefferies initiates coverage on Chalet Hotels with a buy rating. CLSA upgrades Hindalco with a higher target price, and Citigroup moves HDFC AM to neutral. Macquarie reiterates an outperform rating on ITC, citing potential tailwinds.
title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations - check list

author: AMISHA PANDEY
description: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.
title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn’t a good person'

author: SEHJAL GUPTA
description: Candace Owens is facing widespread anger online. A podcast clip featuring her discussing the late Charlie Kirk's past relationships has gone viral. Many believe Owens' comments have deeply hurt Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, who is still grieving. The public is questioning the timing and intent behind sharing such personal memories.
title: Candace Owens faces backlash for sharing private Charlie Kirk stories upsetting widow

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: India's telecom and technology industry bodies are clashing over a new government mandate requiring SIM binding for OTT platforms. While telecom giants like Jio and Airtel welcome the move to curb fraud, tech firms represented by BIF express 'serious concerns' about jurisdiction, consumer impact, and technical feasibility, urging a pause and consultation.
title: OTT vs telcos: WhatsApp, Telegram upset with new rule; Airtel, Jio & Vi praise DoT

author: TNN
description: The Indian rupee plunged to a historic low of 90.29 against the US dollar, breaching the 90 mark for the first time. This sharp decline, attributed to US tariffs and significant foreign investor outflows, is now impacting the broader economy. While a weaker rupee makes imports costlier, it could benefit exporters and help manage the current account deficit.
title: Rupee falls below 90/$ 1st time as US tariffs, FII flows take toll

author: TNN
description: A Bengaluru techie died by suicide, accusing a couple and Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) officials of abetting his extreme act through harassment and extortion. The deceased's mother filed a complaint against Shashi and Usha Nambiar for demanding Rs 20 lakh and allegedly encouraging officials to harass her son. The couple has been remanded in judicial custody.
title: 'Was harassed, tortured': Bengaluru techie dies by suicide; note cites extortion bid

author: SUBRATA CHATTORAJ AND POULAMI ROY
title: Calcutta HC junks order to scrap 32,000 teacher jobs

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: In a humanitarian move, the Indian government will bring back a pregnant Bangladeshi national, Sunali Khatun, and her son after their deportation. The Supreme Court, emphasizing humanity over law, directed the Centre to send Sunali to her father in West Bengal for care. The court also raised questions about her citizenship based on her father's status.
title: Centre agrees to bring back Sunali, son from Bangladesh

author: RASHMI DROLIA
description: Former Maoists are finding new purpose in Chhattisgarh's Bastar Olympics, trading guns for sports.  Surrendered cadres like Kamla and Podiyam Bhima are now training for events like tug-of-war and archery, drawn by the opportunity to rebuild their lives.  This initiative, supported by national leaders, marks a significant shift in the region.
title: Guns to games: Surrendered Naxals back on the field, this time for Bastar Olympics

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Prasidh Krishna faced severe online criticism after India's four-wicket loss to South Africa in the second ODI. His expensive spell, conceding 85 runs in 8.2 overs, allowed South Africa to comfortably chase a target of 359. Despite centuries from Kohli and Gaikwad, Markram's 110 led the visitors to a memorable victory, leveling the series.
title: IND vs SA: 'If Pak have Haris Rauf, India have Prasidh Krishna’ — Pacer draws heavy backlash

author: SAURABH SINHA
description: IndiGo is experiencing significant flight turmoil, impacting hundreds of thousands of travelers due to over 200 cancelled flights and delays reaching up to 10 hours. The airline attributes these challenges to a shortage of pilots and new operational rules. As travel peaks, aviation regulators have called upon IndiGo's leadership to address the chaos and outline a recovery strategy.
title: IndiGo havoc: 200 flights cancelled, up to 10-hour delay; DGCA calls top brass

author: KUMAR MUKESH
description: A chilling child murder spree has been uncovered in Haryana, with a 34-year-old woman, Poonam, confessing to drowning at least four children, including her own toddler son. Driven by an urge to kill children more attractive than her own, she meticulously staged the deaths as accidents. The latest victim was a six-year-old girl at a wedding.
title: ‘Killer mom’: Haryana woman kills 4 children; targeted those ‘more attractive’

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishk Mein' experienced a mid-week dip, earning Rs 6.75 crore on Wednesday. Despite this, the film maintains strong domestic hold, especially in metros, and has crossed Rs 100 crore worldwide. This marks Dhanush's biggest Bollywood hit and his first Rs 100 crore global grosser.
title: 'Tere Ishk Mein' collection: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's movie crosses Rs 100 crore

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: A heartwarming moment saw Rishabh Pant remove an eyelash from Rohit Sharma's face before India's impressive 358/5 in the second ODI. Virat Kohli's 53rd century and Ruturaj Gaikwad's maiden ton powered the score. Rohit also unveiled India's new T20I jersey, expressing confidence for the 2026 World Cup.
title: Viral moment! Rohit Sharma makes a wish after Rishabh Pant spots fallen eyelash - WATCH

author: RASHMI DROLIA
description: A fierce gun battle on the Dantewada-Bijapur border in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region resulted in the deaths of at least 12 Maoists and three District Reserve Guard personnel. This significant loss for the outlawed group occurred as security forces intensified operations in the region. Weapons were recovered, and the search for more insurgents continues.
title: 12 Reds, 3 cops dead as forces push deeper into Bastar; 268 Maoists killed so far in 2025

author: TNN
description: President Vladimir Putin's much-anticipated visit to India begins with a private dinner with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, marking the start of discussions focused on enhancing economic collaboration and strategic partnerships. The leaders will also tackle significant global concerns, particularly India's call for resolving the Russia-Ukraine crisis through diplomatic channels.
title: Putin to begin India visit today with PM Modi’s private dinner; trade in focus

author: TNN
title: Rajasthan: Drunk drags cop for 500m on truck bonnet in Jaipur; driver arrested

author: TNN
title: Rape case: SIT files closure report against Gowda grandson, court rejects it

author: RASHMI DROLIA
title: SIR drive reunites missing Bastar girl with family after 13 years

author: TNN
title: Tamil Nadu: OPS meets Shah amid his push for ADMK ‘course correction’

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Instagram is mandating a five-day return to office for US-based employees starting February 2026, aiming to boost creativity and collaboration. Chief Adam Mosseri announced this, alongside plans for fewer meetings, more product demos over presentations, and faster decision-making. These shifts are designed to propel Instagram forward with renewed vigor and innovation.
title: Work from office returns: Instagram orders 5-day attendance; Meta says it’s time to evolve
